topic.title: Baywatch.2017.FIRST.VHS.EDITION.1080p.VHS.x264-TRACKEDiP [REMIX]
topic.body:
THIS IS NOT THE ACTUAL FILM, IT IS A REMIX CREATED BY THE P2P ECOSYSTEM.
REMOVED FROM YOUTUBE; THE ONLY WAY THIS CAN CIRCULATE, IS BY THE AUTONOMOUS NETWORK WHICH RESISTS THE COPYRIGHT REGIME.

===========================================================

Baywatch.2017.FIRST.VHS.EDITION.1080p.VHS.x264-TRACKEDiP.mp4

Format                                   : MPEG-4
Format profile                           : Base Media
File size                                : 3.69 GiB
Duration                                 : 2 h 1 min
Overall bit rate                         : 4 355 kb/s

Video
ID                                       : 1
Format                                   : AVC
Format/Info                              : Advanced Video Codec
Format profile                           : High@L4
Format settings, CABAC                   : Yes
Format settings, ReFrames                : 2 frames
Codec ID                                 : avc1
Codec ID/Info                            : Advanced Video Coding
Duration                                 : 2 h 1 min
Bit rate                                 : 4 224 kb/s
Width                                    : 1 920 pixels
Height                                   : 1 080 pixels
Display aspect ratio                     : 16:9
Frame rate mode                          : Constant
Frame rate                               : 25.000 FPS
Color space                              : YUV
Chroma subsampling                       : 4:2:0
Bit depth                                : 8 bits
Scan type                                : Progressive
Bits/(Pixel*Frame)                       : 0.081
Stream size                              : 3.58 GiB (97%)
Color range                              : Limited
Color primaries                          : BT.709
Transfer characteristics                 : BT.709
Matrix coefficients                      : BT.709

Audio
ID                                       : 2
Format                                   : AAC
Format/Info                              : Advanced Audio Codec
Format profile                           : LC
Codec ID                                 : 40
Duration                                 : 2 h 1 min
Bit rate mode                            : Constant
Bit rate                                 : 126 kb/s
Channel(s)                               : 2 channels
Channel positions                        : Front: L R
Sampling rate                            : 44.1 kHz
Compression mode                         : Lossy
Stream size                              : 109 MiB (3%)
Default                                  : Yes

===========================================================

The film was extracted via the online swarm, it was then recorded into a VHS tape.

The IP's present in the swarm were logged in a text file, which ended being printed into a binary text.

The tape from the VHS was extracted from the cartridge, and set under a ruler. Every centimeter was taken either as a "0" or a "1" binary value. The order was read and assigned as the one from the binary code, for the IP addresses.

A pair of buzz magnets, sized one centimeter in diameter, were used to write the "0" values on the tape, by placing them on top of the ruler. Big magnets erase magnetic tape, just like a zero value (about 66 IP addresses can remix 70 meters of tape).

The final capture from the VCR, is an audiovisual remix for the commercial film (protected as the holy good, that must not be touched, or used elsewhere but the heavenly main market) and the exact internet addresses of those who broke the business  copyright rules, inside the autonomous web (the P2P swarm), both merged as one last piece of video.

The same process will be repeated using the video from the last Baywatch VHS edition, triggered by each time a new VHS edition  is rejected by the Content ID system, creating a loop between the centralized, and the decentralized networks.

============================================================

Let's find a neutral place where sharing will flourish, take everything from the past and your surroundings, and make  different configurations with it.
